question.text: How many chromosomes will the diploid cell have at G1, after S and after M-phase respectively if the haploid cell has 7 chromosomes?

solution.text: Cell division consists of interphase and mitotic phase. The interphase consists of <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">G</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> and <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">G</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> phases. If M phase is mitosis then all the phases of interphase will have the diploid ploidy level. Thus <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">G</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> and <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">G</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> will have 2n chromosomes i.e. 14 chromosomes.
